intro: Alsine clevelandii, commonly known as Cleveland's alsike, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Alsine clevelandii is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a rare species in its native range.
